alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:59PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Outflow from Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne and southeastern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado, northern Wallace County in west central Kansas, Thomas County in northwestern Kansas, northern Logan County in west central Kansas, southwestern Sheridan, southern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas and northwestern Gove Counties in west central Kansas through 430 PM MDT/530 PM CDT/... At 357 PM MDT/457 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking outflow from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Menlo to near Kanorado.Movement was south at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. Blowing dust has also been observed on KDOT webacams from Goodland to near Colby. If traveling be aware of reductions in visibility. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oakley around 515 PM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 81. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 447 and 450. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
